meanings.definition: Unable to help oneself; powerless or incompetent.
meanings.sent1: The lost puppy looked helpless as it wandered the streets alone.
meanings.sent2: The child felt helpless when he couldn't open the jar of pickles.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel looked helpless trying to reach the bird feeder hanging high up.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood helpless as the storm's strong winds uprooted it from the ground.
meanings.sent5: The injured bird lay helpless on the ground, unable to fly away.

meanings.sent1: The baby bird seemed helpless without its mother nearby.
meanings.sent2: The explorer felt helpless in the dark cave without a flashlight.
meanings.sent3: The kitten looked helpless when faced with a big dog barking at it.
meanings.sent4: The small boat was helpless against the giant waves of the stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The lost child appeared helpless in the crowded mall, looking for their parent.

meanings.definition: Without the means to accomplish something; unable to act or make a decision.
meanings.sent1: The student felt helpless during the exam without studying for it.
meanings.sent2: The stranded hiker was helpless without a map to find the way back.
meanings.sent3: The chef looked helpless in the kitchen without any ingredients to cook with.
meanings.sent4: The driver was helpless in the traffic jam, unable to move forward or backward.
meanings.sent5: The artist felt helpless without any inspiration to create new paintings.
